description.heading: TECHNICAL FIELD
description.p: The present invention relates to a seat belt device. More particularly, the present invention relates to a vehicle seat belt device in which a rotation of a spindle of a retractor for winding a seat belt is detected, and thus detected winding amount or extracting amount is used to control winding operation or extracting operation of the seat belt using an electric actuator.
description.heading: BACKGROUND ART
description.p: As a seat belt device installed in a vehicle, a device in which a seat belt (webbing) is wound and extracted using an electric actuator is known. In this kind of seat belt device, the extracting amount and winding amount of the seat belt are detected and tension applied to the seat belt is adjusted so that the belt does not become loose or too tight while the vehicle is traveling. Usually, a rotation detection unit detects the rotation of the spindle of the retractor, thereby detecting the extracting amount and the winding amount of the seat belt. Thus, the rotation of the spindle is controlled in accordance with the extracting and winding amounts (for example, refer to Patent document 1).

The seat belt device described in Patent document 1 has, as means for detecting the rotation of the spindle, a disc rotating in synchronization with a spindle and a permanent magnet and a magnetic sensor disposed so as to face opposite each other with the disc interposed therebetween. Transmitting sections for transmitting a magnetic field and shielding sections for shielding the magnetic field are provided alternately on the disc in the circumferential direction thereof, and the magnetic sensor detects the change in the magnetic field when the disc passes through between the permanent magnet and the magnetic field, thereby detecting the rotation of the spindle.
From patent document 2 it is known another seat belt device with a retractor comprising a magnet disc for detecting the rotation of the spindle with a high precision. The magnet disc is arranged opposing the spindle.
Patent document 1: Japanese Patent Unexamined Publication No. JP-A-2005-297781
Patent document 2: JP-A-2000-335368 (see also DE-U 299 08 716)
description.heading: DISCLOSURE OF THE INVENTION
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED BY THE INVENTION
description.p: In the seat belt devices described in Patent document 1 and patent document 2 although the rotation of the spindle of the retractor is detected on the basis of the change in the magnetic field, if a disturbance magnetic field is applied to the rotation detection unit, there is a problem that the detection performance is easily affected.

In consideration of the above-mentioned circumstances, an object of the present invention is to provide a seat belt device capable of being less affected by the disturbance magnetic field and capable of detecting the rotation of a spindle with high reliability.
description.heading: MEANS FOR SOLVING PROBLEM
description.p:
The above-mentioned object of the present invention will be achieved through configurations described below.
(1) A seat belt device comprising:
a spindle which winds a seat belt;
a frame which rotatably supports the spindle and contains magnetic material;
a biasing unit which biases the rotation of the spindle in a direction of winding the seat belt, and contains magnetic material;
a rotation detection unit which detects the rotation of the spindle; and
a cover member which accommodates the biasing unit and the rotation detection unit and is installed on side plates of the frame,
wherein the rotation detection unit comprises:
a magnetic disc rotating together with the spindle and
N pole and S pole disposed alternately around an outer circumference thereof at intervals of a constant pitch in a circumferential direction,
wherein the rotation detection unit detects a change in a magnetic field due to the rotation of the magnetic disc in accordance with a rotation of the magnetic disc, wherein
the magnetic disc is disposed between the frame and the biasing unit.
(2) The seat belt device according to (1),
wherein a partition wall, which separates respective accommodation spaces for the biasing member and the rotation detection unit, is provided inside the cover member.
(3) The seat belt device according to (1) or (2),
wherein the rotation detection unit further comprises a detection element which is disposed radially outside of the magnetic disc and converts the change in the magnetic field due to the rotation of the magnetic disc into the electrical signal.
(4) The seat belt device according to (3),
wherein an outer diameter of the outer circumference of the magnetic disc is smaller than an outer diameter of the biasing member.
(5) The seat belt device according to (1),
wherein the cover member is made of resin.

With the seat belt device according to the present invention, since the rotation detection unit for magnetically detecting the rotation of the spindle is disposed between the biasing unit and the frame made of magnetic materials, the rotation detection unit is less affected by a disturbance magnetic field due to the magnetic shielding effect of the magnetic materials, whereby the reliability of the rotation detection can be enhanced.

description.heading: BEST MODES FOR CARRYING OUT THE INVENTION
description.p: A seat belt device according to an embodiment of the present invention will be described below in detail referring to the drawings.

As shown in FIG. 1, a retractor 10 serving as a seat belt device according to this embodiment includes a spindle 12 for winding a seat belt (not shown); a winding spring device 100 for biasing the rotation of the spindle 12 in the winding direction of the seat belt; a locking mechanism 14 for locking the extracting operation of the seat belt depending on acceleration detected using an acceleration sensor (not shown); an electric actuator 18 for generating power for rotating the spindle 12; a pretensioner mechanism 15 for generating other power for rotating the spindle 12; and a power transmission mechanism 17 capable of transmitting the power from the electric actuator 18 to the spindle 12.

Both ends of the spindle 12 are rotatably supported by left and right side plates 11a and 11b of a metallic support frame 11 used as a magnetic material (high-strength steel plate (SPFH590) in this embodiment).

A torque tube (not shown) constituting an energy absorbing mechanism is provided inside the spindle 12. One end side (the left end side in FIG. 1) of the torque tube is connected to the spindle 12 and the other end side (the right end side in FIG. 1) is connected to a tread head 21 to which the power from the pretensioner mechanism 15 is input.

The pretensioner mechanism 15 intensely pushes out a ball (not shown) by virtue of a gas generated by igniting explosive, whereby the ball moves along a groove in a pinion 26. The rotation of the pinion 26 is transmitted to the tread head 21, a torsion bar and a spindle 12 via the locking mechanism 14. In addition, the power from the electric actuator 18 is also transmitted to a joint 22 provided on the spindle 12 via the power transmission mechanism 17. Numeral 23 in FIG. 1 designates a switch housing. A path switching gas generator (not shown) for switching power transmitting passage from the pretensioner mechanism 15 by using the torsion bar is installed in the switch housing 23.

As shown in FIG. 2, the winding spring device 100 includes, inside the casing (cover member) 101 thereof, a metallic winding spring 130 made used as a magnetic material (stainless steel in this embodiment) and serving as biasing unit; a magnetic disc 150 and a magnet sensor unit 160 serving as a rotation detection unit for detecting the rotation of the spindle 12; and a shielding plate (partition wall) 140 made of resin (polyacetal in this embodiment) for shielding between the magnetic disc 150 and the winding spring 130.

The casing 101 includes a lower cover 110 made of resin (polyacetal in this embodiment) and an upper cover 120 made of resin (polypropylene in this embodiment), halved in the axial direction of the spindle 12. The lower cover 110 and the upper cover 120 are joined to each other by engaging the pawl 111 of the lower cover 110 with the upper cover 120. Furthermore, an interior of the casing 101 is partitioned into a sensor accommodating space 102 and a spring accommodating space 103 by engaging the pawl 141 of the shielding plate 140 with the upper cover 120.

Inside the spring accommodating space 103 defined by the upper cover 120 and the shielding plate 140, the winding spring 130 is accommodated, and inside the sensor accommodating space 102 defined by the lower cover 110 and the shielding plate 140, the magnetic disc 150 and the magnet sensor unit 160 are accommodated. With this configuration, the shielding plate 140 prevents interference of the winding spring 130 with the magnetic disc 150 and the magnet sensor unit 160, and the shielding plate 140 securely provides excellent slidability when the winding spring 130 operates. Thus, the shielding plate 140 prevents grease filled inside the spring accommodating space 103 and lubricating the winding spring 130 from entering the disc accommodating space 102.

In addition, the casing 101 is secured to the case 30 of the power transmission mechanism 17 at the engaging sections 121 provided on the upper cover 120 (see FIG. 1). Hence, the magnetic disc 150 and the magnet sensor unit 160 are disposed between the metallic support frame 11 and the metallic winding spring 130.

Furthermore, on the retainer section 151 of the magnetic disc 150, a boss 152 protruding at the center and on both sides thereof is provided, and one end side of the boss 152 is exposed from the central hole 112 of the lower cover 110. The magnetic disc 150 is rotated integrally with the spindle 12 by engaging the square-shaped end protrusion 20 of the spindle 12 with a square hole 153 formed in the end face of the boss 152 on the side of the lower cover 110.

Moreover, the other end side of the boss 152 protrudes from an opening 142 at the center of the shielding plate 140 toward the upper cover 120. An outer circumferential end of the winding spring 130 is secured to the upper cover 120, and an inner circumferential end 131 of the winding spring 130 is engaged with and secured to an engaging groove 154 provided on the other end side of the boss 152. With this configuration, the rotation biasing force of the winding spring 130 is transmitted to the spindle 12 via the retainer section 151 of the magnetic disc 150. Still further, a guide protrusion 122 is provided on the inner face of the upper cover 120, and the guide protrusion 122 is inserted into a guide hole 155 provided in the end face on the other end side of the boss 151 of the magnetic disc 150.

A magnet 156 is disposed on the outer circumferential section of the magnetic disc 150, and the N and S poles of the magnet 156 are arranged at intervals of a constant pitch in the circumferential direction. The outer diameter of the magnetic disc 150 is smaller than an outer diameter of the winding spring. Furthermore, as shown in FIGS. 3 and 4, the magnet sensor unit 160 has two Hall ICs (detection elements) 161A and 161B that convert a change in magnetic field due to rotation of the magnetic disc 150 into an electrical signal and are arranged with a predetermined clearance therebetween. The magnet sensor unit 160 is accommodated inside the sensor housing 165 and disposed radially outside of the magnetic disc 150, and the sensor housing 165 is secured to the lower cover 110 with pawls 113. The lead wires 162 connected to the respective Hall ICs are taken outside from the lead wire extension section 114 provided on the lower cover 110.

FIG. 5 shows the relationship between the Hall ICs 161A and 161B and the magnetic poles of the magnetic disc 150. With this configuration, since the Hall ICs 161A and 161B generate outputs depending on the change in the magnetic flux due to the rotation of the magnetic disc 150, the rotation amount of the spindle 12 can be detected by counting the changes in the outputs of the Hall ICs 161A and 161B. In this case, as shown in FIG. 6A, the two Hall ICs 161A and 161B are disposed so that the changes in the current outputs due to the change in the magnetic field are shifted by a quarter-period phase with respect to each other.

Since 48 N and S poles (24 poles for each) are disposed alternately around the circumference (360°) of the magnetic disc 150, the angle for one pole is "360°/48 poles = 7.5°." Furthermore, since two-phase (one Hall IC 161A and one Hall IC 161B) detection is performed, the detectable resolution is 3.75° (= 7.5°/2).

When the resolution (3.75°) is converted into the length of the belt at the time of the latching of the seat belt into a buckle (calculated assuming that the winding diameter of the belt is 50 mm), the resolution becomes 1.63 mm, whereby the movement length of the belt can be detected at a fairly high accuracy.

Besides, since the two Hall ICs 161A and 161B are used, it is possible to detect the rotation direction of the spindle 12 using both outputs thereof. When the change shown in FIG. 6B is detected, it can be judged that the rotation is performed in the winding direction. On the other hand, when the change shown in FIG. 6C is detected, it can be judged that the rotation is performed in the extracting direction.

The extracting or winding operation of the belt can be controlled accurately depending on the traveling state of a vehicle by monitoring the extracting amount or the winding amount of the belt using the outputs of the magnet sensor unit 160 as described above.

According to the seat belt device of this embodiment, since the rotation detection unit (the magnetic disc 150 and the magnet sensor unit 160) for magnetically detecting the rotation of the spindle 12 is disposed between the winding spring 130 and the frame 11 formed so as to contain magnetic materials, the rotation detection unit is less affected by a disturbance magnetic field due to the magnetic shielding effect of the magnetic materials, whereby the reliability of the rotation detection is enhanced.
In addition, since the Hall ICs 161A and 161B are disposed radially outside of the magnetic disc 150, the dimension of the spindle in the axial direction thereof can be made compact.

Furthermore, since the winding spring 130 and the magnet sensor unit 160 are accommodated in the casing 101 that can be divided in the axial direction of the spindle 12 and these are sub-assembled as a one unit, assembling can be completed by simply installing the unit on the side plate 11a of the frame 11 via the case 30 of the power transmission mechanism 17, whereby handling during the assembling is facilitated.

Moreover, since the shielding plate 140 for partitioning the respective accommodation spaces for the winding spring 130 and the rotation detection unit is provided inside the casing 101, it is possible to prevent physical interference between the winding spring 130 and the magnetic disc 150 and the magnet sensor unit 160 serving as the rotation detection unit. Still further, the grease filled in the spring accommodating space 103 for the winding spring 130 can be prevented from entering the side of the rotation detection unit. Hence, the performance of the rotation detection unit is not impaired, and the rotation detection unit can deliver stable detection functions.

The present invention is not limited to the above-mentioned embodiment but can be modified and improved as necessary.
The biasing unit according to the present invention is not limited to the winding spring 130 according to the above-mentioned embodiment but may be a component that is used to bias the rotation of the spindle 12 in the winding direction of the seat belt and is formed so as to contain a magnetic material.
Moreover, the rotation detection unit should only be means for magnetically detecting the rotation of the spindle 12 and is not limited to the above-mentioned embodiment.

claim.claim-text: Sicherheitsgurtvorrichtung, umfassend: eine Spindel (12), die einen Sicherheitsgurt aufwickelt; einen Rahmen, der die Spindel (12) drehbar hält und magnetisches Material enthält; eine Vorspanneinheit, die die Drehung der Spindel (12) in eine Aufwickelrichtung des Sicherheitsgurts vorspannt und magnetisches Material enthält; eine Drehungserfassungseinheit, die die Drehung der Spindel (12) erfasst; und ein Abdeckelement, das die Vorspanneinheit und die Drehungserfassungseinheit aufnimmt und an Seitenplatten des Rahmens angebracht ist, wobei die Drehungserfassungseinheit Folgendes umfasst: eine Magnetscheibe (150), die sich zusammen mit der Spindel (12) dreht, und N-Pol und S-Pol, die abwechselnd um einen Außenumfang davon in Abständen mit einem gleichmäßigen Zwischenraum in einer Umfangsrichtung angeordnet sind, wobei die Drehungserfassungseinheit eine Änderung des Magnetfelds durch die Drehung der Magnetscheibe (150) entsprechend einer Drehung der Magnetscheibe (150) erfasst, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Magnetscheibe (150) zwischen dem Rahmen und der Vorspanneinheit angeordnet ist.

Sicherheitsgurtvorrichtung nach Anspruch 1,
wobei eine Trennwand, die jeweilige Aufnahmeräume für das Vorspannelement und die Drehungserfassungseinheit trennt, in dem Abdeckelement angeordnet ist.

Sicherheitsgurtvorrichtung nach Anspruch 1 oder 2,
wobei die Drehungserfassungseinheit ferner ein Erfassungselement umfasst, das radial außerhalb der Magnetscheibe (150) angeordnet ist und die Änderung des Magnetfelds durch die Drehung der Magnetscheibe (150) in das elektrische Signal umwandelt.

Sicherheitsgurtvorrichtung nach Anspruch 3,
wobei ein Außendurchmesser des Außenumfangs der Magnetscheibe (150) geringer ist als ein Außendurchmesser des Vorspannelements.

Sicherheitsgurtvorrichtung nach Anspruch 1,
wobei das Abdeckelement aus Harz hergestellt ist.

A seat belt device comprising: a spindle (12) which winds a seat belt; a frame which rotatably supports the spindle (12) and contains magnetic material; a biasing unit which biases the rotation of the spindle (12) in a direction of winding the seat belt, and contains magnetic material; a rotation detection unit which detects the rotation of the spindle (12); and a cover member which accommodates the biasing unit and the rotation detection unit and is installed on side plates of the frame, wherein the rotation detection unit comprises: a magnetic disc (150) rotating together with the spindle (12) and N pole and S pole disposed alternately around an outer circumference thereof at intervals of a constant pitch in a circumferential direction, wherein the rotation detection unit detects a change in a magnetic field due to the rotation of the magnetic disc (150) in accordance with a rotation of the magnetic disc (150), characterized in that the magnetic disc (150) is disposed between the frame and the biasing unit.

The seat belt device according to claim 1,
wherein a partition wall, which separates respective accommodation spaces for the biasing member and the rotation detection unit, is provided inside the cover member.

The seat belt device according to claim 1 or 2,
wherein the rotation detection unit further comprises a detection element which is disposed radially outside of the magnetic disc (150) and converts the change in the magnetic field due to the rotation of the magnetic disc (150) into the electrical signal.

The seat belt device according to claim 3,
wherein an outer diameter of the outer circumference of the magnetic disc (150) is smaller than an outer diameter of the biasing member.

The seat belt device according to claim 1,
wherein the cover member is made of resin.

Dispositif de ceinture de sécurité comprenant : une broche (12) qui enroule une ceinture de sécurité ; un cadre qui supporte de manière rotative la broche (12) et contient un matériau magnétique ; une unité de précontrainte qui précontraint la rotation de la broche (12) dans une direction d'enroulement de la ceinture de sécurité, et contient un matériau magnétique ; une unité de détection de rotation qui détecte la rotation de la broche (12) ; et un élément de recouvrement qui loge l'unité de précontrainte et l'unité de détection de rotation et qui est monté sur des plaques latérales du cadre, l'unité de détection de rotation comprenant : un disque magnétique (150) tournant conjointement avec la broche (12) et pôle N et pôle S, disposés en alternance autour d'une circonférence extérieure de celui-ci à des intervalles d'écartement constant dans une direction circonférentielle, l'unité de détection de rotation détectant un changement dans un champ magnétique dû à la rotation du disque magnétique (150) conformément à une rotation du disque magnétique (150), caractérisé en ce que le disque magnétique (150) est disposé entre le cadre et l'unité de précontrainte.

Dispositif de ceinture de sécurité selon la revendication 1,
dans lequel une paroi de séparation, qui sépare des espaces de logement respectifs pour l'élément de précontrainte et l'unité de détection de rotation, est prévue à l'intérieur de l'élément de recouvrement.

Dispositif de ceinture de sécurité selon la revendication 1 ou 2,
dans lequel l'unité de détection de rotation comprend en outre un élément de détection qui est disposé radialement à l'extérieur du disque magnétique (150) et convertit le changement dans le champ magnétique dû à la rotation du disque magnétique (150) en signal électrique.

Dispositif de ceinture de sécurité selon la revendication 3,
dans lequel un diamètre extérieur de la circonférence extérieure du disque magnétique (150) est inférieur à un diamètre extérieur de l'élément de précontrainte.

Dispositif de ceinture de sécurité selon la revendication 1,
dans lequel l'élément de recouvrement est fabriqué en résine.
